column4: Guys, anyone knows how to connect to a VPN connection in command-line (already set with network-manager-pptp)
I use  vpnc  (but it may be Cisco specific)
I use it to vpn to my work. It is a cli thing.
Comand Line Interface
what you need basically :)
true :)
did your   /etc/hosts   file change?
How do I know if it changed? and what do you mean by that? What can happen if it changed?
date stamp will tell you. Bad  /etc/hosts  file can cause long startup delays for some programs
actually my system hangs for a long time while booting. I don't know why! How can I fix that?
depends on the messages you get from   dmesg
can you please explain? I am not familar with dmesg
I used it in termial and got a big list of I don't know what!
look for EE in  dmesg (run from terminal)
What is EE?
EE = error
probably :)
I did it, doesn't seem to have found EE: "[    0.000000] ACPI: DSDT 3BEAC408, 3AEE (r1 TOSINV    SB450  6040000 MSFT  100000E)"
I mean that's the only line I get with dmesg | grep EE
However, using "dmesg | grep error" shows : "[   26.104332] ACPI: Looking for DSDT in initramfs... error, file /DSDT.aml not found."
you can also check the timestamp beside the messages to see when stuff happens
